page.title: 01HOUGHTON ESTATE-HOUGHTON.
page.content: Block O576O327 situated along the watershed of the North West Norfolk chalk ridge,is a gently undulating plain at 7O metres with a sandy soil of glacial origin and varying fertility.Tumulii and a short section ofthe Roman Peddars Way are in the South West.Houghton Hall,a particularly fine Palladian mansion,with its attendant stables,water tower,park land, woods,farms,and the model village of New Houghton,built outside the main gates,occupy the whole area.The original village was razed when the Hall was built in the early 18th.century by Sir Robert Walpole,but the church,with a notably slanted apse,remains,still in use but within the park.The Hall and grounds are open to the public..
